stage01.name: Thanatos
sentences: Remember, this is not a dream.
And yet, it is not reality either.
You are here, only to see yourself.
Once again, welcome to Caelum.

stage02.name: Thanatos
sentences: How was tonight's warm-up?
Archer has been looking forward to it recently.

stage02.name: Orpheus
sentences: What's there to look forward to? We're just beating each other up.
And to answer your question, it's as gruesome as usual.

stage02.name: Thanatos
sentences: Now, now, beating each other up is a nice bonding activity from what I can see.
It's not just Archer. The others also seem excited to face you again.

stage02.name: Orpheus
sentences: That... just sounds like they're happy to clobber me.

stage02.name: Thanatos
sentences: I suppose I can't convince you with just words, but maybe Spear can with her actions.
Go on, let's not make her wait too long.

stage03.name: Thanatos
sentences: Any changes?

stage03.name: Orpheus
sentences: She certainly did seem to be enjoying the fight. Does that have anything to do with me though?
I think she just likes to fight, regardless who she's against.

stage03.name: Thanatos
sentences: There is truth to that, yes. But, you see...
I've known her for a loooong time. I can tell when she enjoys beating up the opponent, and when she enjoys facing an opponent she respects.

stage03.name: Orpheus
sentences: ... Flattering, but I'm no worthy opponent.
I don't see how or why she'd respect me.

stage03.name: Thanatos
sentences: I'll let Cross show you the answer to that.
Guy's a good pep-talker. Or should I say, pep-shooter.

stage03.name: Orpheus
sentences: That was terrible.

stage04.name: Orpheus
sentences: *heavy breathing*
Hold. Let me rest for a bit.
*inhales* *exhales* Okay. Phew.
I know what you're going to ask.
I must admit, I've been dodging his bolts more recently. But that's no big deal, right?
He even shoots slower than Archer.

stage04.name: Thanatos
sentences: Ouch. He might get hurt if he hears that, you know.
Anyways.
You have improved greatly since your first battle. I still remember the greenhorn who could not dodge any of his bolts.
I think that's impressive, your growth. I believe Cross thinks so too, and not only him.
I you talk to them more, I'm sure they'll tell you the same thing, and maybe they'll even tell you more than that.

stage04.name: Orpheus
sentences: I don't know if you could tell this obvious fact, but I'm not much of a small-talk person.
I'm not trying to be a jerk. I just don't know how to do it.

stage04.name: Thanatos
sentences: You sure you're not trying? That was some sass just now.
But I have noticed, yes.
I'm not saying you should change that part of you completely, but if you don't take any bit of the olive branch, you're gonna end up alone for a long time to come, you know.
You could start by asking about their day. That simple.

stage04.name: Orpheus
sentences: Simple to say, but not that simple to do. Not to me at least.
I see your point, though.
In any case, I've rested enough. The early I go in there, the earlier I can get out.
See you around.

stage05.name: Thanatos
sentences: You looked distraught iin the first half of that battle.
What did Ninja say to make you look so determined now?

stage05.name: Orpheus
sentences: I was thinking about what you said, and that made me lose concentration.
Ninja pointed out that I'm being rude by not paying full attention to the fight, but he didn't seem to be offended about it.
I didn't pick up on this before, but he seems to be a chill dude. And silent, kind of like me.

stage05.name: Thanatos
sentences: He is, indeed. If you talk to him next time too, maybe you'll find even more similarities between you two.
Speaking of chill dudes, Paladin is the same. Care to go have a chat with him?

stage05.name: Orpheus
sentences: I... I think I can try.
Paladin has always been talkative. I suppose he'll be driving most the conversation.

stage05.name: Thanatos
sentences: That's even better for you, isn't it?

stage05.name: Orpheus
sentences: Guess so...
I'm going now.

stageEnd.name: Orpheus
sentences: You were right. He did drive most of the conversation. And it wasn't too bad.
He didn't judge every sentence I said. He listened to me. And he responded to me.
Ninja did too, now that I think about it.

stageEnd.name: Thanatos
sentences: What about the rest, then?

stageEnd.name: Orpheus
sentences: I don't know. I haven't talked to them much.
Maybe I should. They seem like they would do the same as Paladin.
I think I'll try to next time.

stageEnd.name: Thanatos
sentences: They will, I guarantee you that.
And on that note, congratulations, Orpheus. You've made it through another night.
I too, look forward to seeing you here again tomorrow.
